Control

Class AccessController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Control.AccessController

  • public class AccessController
extends java.lang.Object
    An AccessController class to check whether the student has access to the Stars Planner system
    Since:
    2017-04-01
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ameen, Ashiq, Will, Reuben, Waqas

      Separator which is used to break elements read from a text file

    • Method Detail

      • accessPeriod

        public boolean accessPeriod()
        A method which is used by the Admin to set the the time and date for Students to access the Stars System
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean which is true when the Time and Date has been set successfully and false if otherwise

      • readAccess

        public java.util.ArrayList readAccess()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        A method that calls the read() method to read all the content and processes it to store in an access object and returns it as an ArrayList
        Returns:
        returns a Single ArrayList of Access object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Passes the exception thrown to the method that calls this method in the event where there is problems reading the file

      • checkStudentAccess

        public boolean checkStudentAccess(java.util.Date currentDate,
                                  java.util.Date currentTime)
                           throws java.text.ParseException
        A method which takes in parameters of the current date and current time of the student logging in and checks against the text file to check if the Student is allowed to access or not.
        Parameters:
        currentDate - The current date based on the students systems clock
        currentTime - The current time based on the students systems clock
        Returns:
        A boolean which is either true or false.True means the student has access to the system and false means otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - An exception is thrown when the method is unable to read the current date and current time in a particular format

      • displayAccessPeriod

        public void displayAccessPeriod()
        A method to display the access period to the user
